intro: Scorzonera vaginata, commonly known as the European scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow to orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a reddish or purplish hue. Scorzonera vaginata is also known for its edible roots, which have been used in traditional cuisine.
